resources.string:
You are about to evaluate an Android application regarding its behavior on a bare Android Open Source Project (AOSP) device. The device must not have the official Google Play Services installed.

If the device is running microG, please make sure that the application was tested with SafetyNet disabled in microG settings.

Sapio will detect automatically if microG is installed on your device.

If the Proceed button is disabled, it is probably because your phone is a Google Certified phone or that SafetyNet is still activated in your microG settings.
Select the application you want to evaluate
It works perfectly. All features are usable as intended.
It works partially. Some features do not work.
It does not work at all or crashes.

Sapio is the anagram of Open Source API.

Sapio aims to provide an estimation of how Google dependent an Android application is, informing the community on how it behaves on bare Android Open Source Project (AOSP), coupled or not with microG.

Evaluations in Sapio are given by the community to the community.
Brain icons created by Freepik - Flaticon
